website_summaries.verdict: Good balance and design make this axe an excellent choice for those on a budget.
pros: Holds a decent edge, even after heavy use

customer_reviews.title: Metal is garbage
customer_reviews.text: Please note that this axe is NOT for falling trees with. After 7 trees the axe bent down the arm. I called the company and they told me that I was abusing the axe........ Trust me , don’t buy this paper weight . It might would cut a limb or two but for man stuff - no .
customer_reviews.author: CVines

customer_reviews.title: Light duty ax only
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this ax a couple of years ago and used it just a twice before today. This morning i needed to cut an eight inch branch from an oak tree and this is what it looked like when i was finished. The branch was off the ground and i looked to make sure there I had not hit an old nail or other metal object. This ax must not be intended for heavy chopping or the heat treatment of this particular ax was not done correctly. I would appreciate hearing from Amazon or Estwing about a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: RCS

customer_reviews.title: Scary and sloppy construction. Nevery buy a blade that was welded
customer_reviews.text: Hard core let down. Im returning the product. Spot welded fold on the front tip. Seemn it that look like it was made from a hammer with a cutting bit attached. I was a forester and im sad to say id never sling this thing. It has a higher chance of killing you then the wilderness.
customer_reviews.author: pretz

customer_reviews.title: Bent splitting firewood after 2 camping trips
customer_reviews.text: So i bought this for camping, at first i loved it. I was excited to have a quality axe of solid steel, as I'm not a huge fan of wooden handles. It worked great for our first camping trip of 3 days used for splitting firewood. Our second camping trip we went out for another 3 days and used again for splitting firewood, except as i was splitting wood i noticed the grip felt different, when i looked at the axe it was severely bent.
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: nice felling axe for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed. I'm 5'6" and not in ideal shape muscle-wise. The axe was a comfortable weight and size for my frame. The edge was sharp. I used it to fell a 6-inch diameter tree that was growing horizontally due to canopy shading it from sunlight. I wore a pair of decent work gloves and felt no shock in my hands or forearms. In don't use chainsaws and this tree could not be cut down with a bow saw; this axe made light work of it. I expect to use this more as a felling axe and not as a log-splitter.
customer_reviews.author: chickenbutt

customer_reviews.title: Possible tempering issue.
customer_reviews.text: About a inch deep half moon broke off the center of the blade in side piece of fir kindling. The wood was not of any special density or ovely knarled. I've been heating w/wood for about 25 yrs now. Strange that the blade would fracture in this way. All in all i really liked the sleek look and feel and all metal design of this axe so needless to say i was very disappointed went the fracture happened. Idk if it was a deformity in the grain structure of the blade or possibly a tempering issue but very very intrigued to very disappointed:(.
customer_reviews.author: Ridley

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Estwing hammers for 40 years and there is a reason for that, but when it came to making this axe somebody dropped the ball. If the axe I received represents today's Estwing products I will not be purchasing any more tools from them. The fit and finish are lousy. The butt of the rubber handle is chewed up, There are blemishes in the fiberglass coating on the neck and the cutting edge is not what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Preferred Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great axe for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great axe for the money. Used to replace an exact same axe that was a solid decade old that I broke the handle off on. That is this axe's fatal flaw though. The upper portion is solis and the blue portion is hollow. Rust and improper use (this is used in a scout environment so a lot of novice use) can damage the hollow section at the joint.
customer_reviews.author: Chris-in-Holly

customer_reviews.title: this axe is sharp
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp lite weight perfect for a back pack not so much a wood splitter but I do not think it was designed for that. Used on my hunting lease easy to carry and easy to put an edge on it. You can tell this axe was built for a purpose cutting limbs, small to mid size stuff it is a decent chopper but with the lite weight it looses a little cutting power like I said it was designed with a purpose lite weight sharp easy to carry keep it oiled and use it correctly should last a life time.
customer_reviews.author: just my honest opinion

customer_reviews.title: Quality is job one with Eastwing
customer_reviews.text: What can I say. This is an excellent high quality product. Ever since 40 years ago when I swung a 20 oz framing hammer, Eastwing has been the way to go. I lost that one. Unfortunately, I haven't always had the money to afford their products or convinced myself of that and you kind of blanche when you compare prices....and so you buy the cheap one...and then later you pick up the Eastwing and regret all the time you had the cheap one. Just buy it, take care of it, and you will not regret your purchase, no matter what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Redfour5

customer_reviews.title: Superb axe, like everything else Estwing makes.
customer_reviews.text: Best axe for its size. Great for splitting, cleaning up, Does come w/ a nylon sheath, but can order separate leather one. I use it for splitting kindling for my chiminea or limited splitting of larger logs. If I had a ton of firewood, i'd want something longer. But, the metal construction is top notch. Would be great for limited mobility folks. I often split while seated on a bucket, and no problem. Not a wide head, so does get stuck in and have to drop split from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: Big Tx

customer_reviews.title: Axe throwing approved
customer_reviews.text: So long as your form is good, and you have a beard, any axe can be thrown into a tree. My lack of a fifth star is on this particular axe, where the blue meets silver, there is this unnecessary piece of yellow tape/sticker (I removed it). I wish it was just a smooth transition. When I grab the axe out of the tree, I feel that gap. Not a big deal, but something worth noting. If you were to ever use this for chopping, I am sure it will work great! I have had three trees fall over from my axe throwing hobby!
customer_reviews.author: oldOtter

customer_reviews.title: Estwing camping axe
customer_reviews.text: Made in the USA! Enough said! This Estwing axe is the best axe Ive ever used. It stays mounted in my FJ Cruiser and I go camping almost every weekend. Very easy to sharpen and holds an edge very well. Perfect size for me at 26”. Weight is perfect and balanced just right. The blade cover is very well made with two snaps to keep it secure. The axe handle is very comfortable and has a great grip while chopping wood. Very happy with my purchase. Buy it! You will like it knowing its made in the USA and not cheap China steel.
customer_reviews.author: JRW

customer_reviews.title: After sharpened it works great. Remember it isn't a full axe so taking ...
customer_reviews.text: After sharpened it works great. Remember it isn't a full axe so taking it against nooted wood might cause it to bend overtime expecially with hardwoods. The sheath did fall apart but probably due to I having it freshly sharpened and using the back of it to set a tier 22 handhole lid back into its place. Other than that its worked like it should for a hunk of steel on a stick.
customer_reviews.author: Corey McClure

customer_reviews.title: Great all purpose axe - as long as you have the time to redo the entire blade surface
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Perfect size, weight, and balance for a bushcraft, camping, or all purpose axe. It feels really good and I like the all metal design. Cons: The blade looked pretty awful. Knicks, uneven surfaces, and what appear to be areas on the blade where it was pressed against the grinding device awkwardly when they were trying to shape the blade. It will take a good bit of time trying to reshape and recover the edge. Overall it looks like I received a quality assurance reject that was resold via amazon
customer_reviews.author: Some dude

customer_reviews.title: Smooth
customer_reviews.text: I have a ton of bamboo in my backyard and I've tried using everything from saws, chainsaws, and machetes to cut it down. Some tools took too much labor. The chainsaw kicked when the bamboo would start to fall. So I decided to splurge on this axe. It's fantastic. I can cut down 1-3" shoots in just a few chops. And it's easy on my wrists and hands. Glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Good axe
customer_reviews.text: This is a good little axe. It is strong, durable, lightweight and cuts nice; especially for an axe in this price range. It's not as good as the Gran Forsbruk I have but it's a great starter axe or an axe to use in icy cold where a wooden handle may not make it. It is also a great pick-up axe. I have used them for years and just bought one for my daughter to start her axe collection with.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works, for the most part
customer_reviews.text: It's lightweight, and it does what it's supposed to do. The handle isn't very long, so don't expect to get crazy leverage on your swings. Also, I'm not sure if my chopping technique is off, or if I'm cutting super-hard wood, but the chopping edge had quite a few nicks in it after around four pieces of wood. YMMV.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Fairchild

customer_reviews.title: I have had many other Estwing tools going back to the 50's and have never been disappointed by any of them
customer_reviews.text: This axe completely met my expectations for my purposes, which is as an emergency camp axe. We are in the subduction earthquake zone and rural and need to be prepared to be self-sufficient for a lengthy period of time. The axe is well constructed with one piece steel head and handle. It is balanced perfectly and the rubber cover on the handle absorbs shock and vibration. It arrived well sharpened and included a leather cover for the blade. I was able to cut through a 6" trunk on a hardwood tree with ease. I have had many other Estwing tools going back to the 50's and have never been disappointed by any of them, nor have any ever broken.
customer_reviews.author: Cruzer

customer_reviews.title: It came dull, but still indestructible.
customer_reviews.text: I have many Estwing axes, and only a few showed up properly sharpened. Since sometimes they come with a decent edge, makes me wonder why they can't do it every time. Took me 15 minutes with a fine file and stone to fix. It's still a solid, full tang piece of steel. If this handle breaks, you are in Antarctica or experienced a nuclear attack.
customer_reviews.author: willyp00

customer_reviews.title: Extreemly nice 26 inch ax
customer_reviews.text: Just got this today and Estwing 26 inch ax for 40 bucks with sheath is a great value. perfect size for small jobs maybe even splitting seasoned firewood. Very happy with purchased and I just bought another for my shop. I have an Estwing framing hammer with grips like this ax that is almost 40 years old and still in good shape.
customer_reviews.author: Stevenator

customer_reviews.title: No quality control!
customer_reviews.text: Axe was delivered with very noticeable uneven flaws in the edge. I decided to skip going through the headache of returning it and reshaped the edge myself. I was able to work the flaws out and get the axe very sharp. Unfortunately, the second time I used it to cut wood, I noticed a few small chips in the edge. Pretty disappointed that I put some much time into something that should have been right to begin with, only to have it fail.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, sharp, and very high quality!
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and razor sharp, an excellent axe that is mid-way between a hatchet and a full felling axe, and useful enough to fill both roles. The fact that it comes with an effective sheath is definitely a huge plus, as it would cost ten dollars or so to buy a sheath otherwise. I'm very happy with this axe.
customer_reviews.author: acorn-sunflower

customer_reviews.title: I expected more
customer_reviews.text: One day of shopping minor pine logs in this axe has already separated from its handle. I expected more from East wing
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best axe ever, Made In America
customer_reviews.text: My friend the landscaper has one and when I used it to cut some roots I just had to have one for myself. No vibration due to the solid one piece construction and balanced perfectly. This axe will last forever, Made in America, not cheap junk. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony c. Paciolla

customer_reviews.title: Great camp axe, multipurpose, durable, fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: Got this to bring camping, secured easily onto my pack or I strap it onto my belt. After using estwing hammers for years I was confident this would be a good axe and I was correct. It's no spitting maul but I've been able to cut lots of firewood with it, as well as hammer stakes into hard ground/ground with lots of roots in it. Used it a few times now and I love it. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew T McDermott

customer_reviews.title: Chipped Blade
customer_reviews.text: Drive strikes in while cutting firewood, the blade chips. I know it’s not the wood as it’s been high and dry for two years. Unfortunately I was camping and I had no alternative but keep using the chipped blade of the axe. It’s a shame because it’s so comfortable and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Kirt Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Sloppily made but durable
customer_reviews.text: The axe is nowhere near on or with their hammers and other tools.... the whole thing is just sloppily made and the handle grip looks like someone took an angle grinder to it and the axe blade itself looks bent .... but after really looking at it that’s the way it was ground
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Page

customer_reviews.title: No Leather Sheath
customer_reviews.text: Axe itself looks great but the description specifically states it comes with an Embossed Leather Sheath for Safe Storage. Mine arrived with a nylon sheath. Sending it back for a refund due to that fact. Have to love Amazon's easy return policy but I'd still like the axe with a leather sheath as described.
customer_reviews.author: R Rich

customer_reviews.title: Great Camping Axe
customer_reviews.text: I also have the shorter hatchet version and they are identical save from this one is longer. I did chop a large piece of wood in two to be split later. The sheath is nice that comes with it. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Richard G

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and size for light home use
customer_reviews.text: Awesome axe. Great size and weight for homeowner use such as splitting seasoned firewood and chopping out small tree roots. Seems well made and blade is durable and seems to stay sharp. I like the ergonomic handle to absorb shock on my carpal tunnel wrists. Good axe! Markkowaleski.com
customer_reviews.author: Mark Kowaleski

customer_reviews.title: my favorite axe
customer_reviews.text: It is a light weight axe for limbing or chopping smaller trees. I love love love it, and it is good for clean splitting (trees without knots) but it is very lightweight...it also is very very thin.
customer_reviews.author: Apollo

customer_reviews.title: Great axe, great price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great medium size, or camping, axe. It is all steel and virtually indestructible. I got the blue color one that was on sale for $20 less than the black color one. It also came with a good quality detachable cover for the axe head.
customer_reviews.author: ckrug

customer_reviews.title: Estwing Quality once again
customer_reviews.text: Nothing's changed as far as Estwings quality. This campers ax is another lifetime tool from the people who know how to build tools. I wish there where redwood trees needing felling in Iowa, I'd take a crack at it!
customer_reviews.author: M Turk

customer_reviews.title: This is it!
customer_reviews.text: I have used every axe style working in Florida woods for 50 years and a man had one of these. I used it ten minutes and bought this with overnite delivery. I have axes over 100 years old, my favorites, but they have been retired. If this axe can't do the job, better go get a two man chainsaw or a Franklin Tree Farmer
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: I love estwing products and this one is no different
customer_reviews.text: I love estwing products and this one is no different. Some might not like that its one solid piece of metal. But I do even though the axe might be a little heavy it's totally worth caring into the woods especially if it's winter.
customer_reviews.author: ENP

customer_reviews.title: Love the balance
customer_reviews.text: Love the balance, fit and weight of this ax. Gave one each as Christmas presents to my two boys who camp, hike, have their own homes and have young families who they take on outdoor activities. One in Alaska and one in Eastern Washington. These are best used for light tree chopping. branch trimming and kindling splitting. The handle is long enough that one does not short circle swing and cut a leg or foot as when using a short handle hatchet. Great grip for all around use. Great vibration control and the handle will not normally break under average use.
customer_reviews.author: david walton

customer_reviews.title: Poor condition on receipt
customer_reviews.text: The axe as I received it is rough around the edges. The blade appears to have been machined rather than ground because it was still covered in burs that I had to hone off with a file myself. The haft is also bent or warped a few degrees to the right in hand; given that it's a single piece of hard steel I assume this is due to poor control of differential cooling during manufacture and not a bend that was introduced later. I'll only be using the axe a few times a year to split firewood while camping, so it's fine for me. I wouldn't want to rely on it for heavy use though.
customer_reviews.author: Rune

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I had a smaller one for camping and it destroyed my shoulders and arms. This thing is a solid axe. Works well, has a nice weight and look to it. I will be using this for a while to come.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Murray

customer_reviews.title: Not splitting. Camping axe!!!
customer_reviews.text: Not a splitting axe. I use mine for kindling. Light for camping tho
customer_reviews.author: GettingToOldForThis

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't tested this ax too much but so far I'm really liking it. It looks great and it seems solid, came very sharp. Especially for a relatively inexpensive ax. Taking it camping next week, we'll see how it does!
customer_reviews.author: JM76

customer_reviews.title: Good light camp axe
customer_reviews.text: Hard to beat this for the price as a light camp and utility axe. Solid one-piece steel with a comfortable hande. You're not going to be felling mighty oaks with this, nor are you going to split big logs. But for smaller chores it's ideal. Came good and sharp and it's big enough to do work with yet light enough to take backpacking for overnights.
customer_reviews.author: Lanzman

customer_reviews.title: To light and too short a handle for doing something like splitting cord wood
customer_reviews.text: For what I need it for it will work. My employee broke two ash handle axes trying to get out one stump, so I bought just so it would be bomb proof. To light and too short a handle for doing something like splitting cord wood.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Caption

customer_reviews.title: Happy to have this around the house...
customer_reviews.text: Not your primary splitter, but a must have around the house if the use fire wood. This will make short work of dry logs, as well as is extremely helpful with smaller trees and branches. Keep in mind it is shorter then a splitting axe and thus needs to have a "big brother" around to do that type work. That said once wood is dry, if you want to split it smaller etc this will work wonders!!! Keep away from small finger though as it is very sharp and though it appears to be "kid sized" this tool delivers adult size results.
customer_reviews.author: Statler And Waldorf

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, poor cover. Needs to be leather
customer_reviews.text: Great Ax. Just wish the cover was more durable. The ax blade slices through the cloth blade protector pretty easy. Maybe they can offer a leather upgrade cover.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Thomas Mcevoy

customer_reviews.title: great hatchet, poor axe
customer_reviews.text: extra length makes it better than a hatchet for hacking through brush and removing small limbs, way to short and light for any serious chopping with out putting in a lot of extra effort...less than 3 inch diameter it works good, larger it is poor....you could split small kindling if you had too, but it really doesn't split wood worth crap
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and perfectly weighted.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my hurricane relief trip where I clear lots of vegetation. This axe was very sharp and cut straight through 1-1/2" diameter trees with one swing and some 2" . It is the perfect weight for a good swing and has great leverage
customer_reviews.author: JN

customer_reviews.title: Gonna enjoy this axe!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a jack of all trades, master of none axe that was not made in India, China, or Mexico. This was the one for me and I am very happy with it. I spoke with Estwing customer service (Illinois) that day I bought it. They were very helpful and said if there are any defects at ANY time to take a couple pictures and send it to them to review. If there are any workmanship issues (having since received it I can say there aren't) they will replace for free. I can't wait to take it camping. I've split some unseasoned hard wood with it already and it performs as expected. Love my new axe.
customer_reviews.author: CombsForce

customer_reviews.title: Quality and function for great value
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality tool that does a great job of cutting without the heavy and awkward feel of many other brands. I am getting elderly and appreciate still being able to do necessary chopping on my property
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great axe well priced
customer_reviews.text: Amazing axe! Light weight came sharpened and ready to go! Used it a lot this summer on roots while digging. Held up great don’t see way I would ever go with a different brand of axe again. Work or camping easy axe to store and transport. Rubber grip is great but I want the wood one too now! Big fan of this.
customer_reviews.author: Joey P

customer_reviews.title: Bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: This is the longest quality hatchet I could find even remotely in this price range, and I have been very satisfied with the product. It chops right through pretty big logs without much issue.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, lightweight, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent quality axe. I’ve been a big fan of Estwing since I was a kid and had my Estwing hammer. The blade is sharp, it is easy to use, any great size for camping or household use.
customer_reviews.author: Doug T.

customer_reviews.title: NO LEATHER SHEATH
customer_reviews.text: Description says comes with embossed leather sheath it does not It comes with a blue cordura nylon sheath The same axe and sheath can be bought at Home Depot for a couple $ less Estwing E45A campers axe is the perfect camp and backpacking axe Great for chopping and light splitting ( kindling ) Comes with a good edge right out of the box Can be used one or two handed
customer_reviews.author: Neil Luke

customer_reviews.title: Very soft steel, do not use on anything resembling hardwood
customer_reviews.text: The axe is exceptionally light weight and initially I had hope. However, after three strikes to a ~3" diameter trunk, the blade has been just ruined. I can (and will) sharpen it and try to clean it up with a grinder. I would only recommend using this on very soft wood or paper materials. Don't try to do any serious work with trees.
customer_reviews.author: Nomeneiste

customer_reviews.title: Good vehicle axe, too heavy for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: It came with a nick in the blade and that's the only reason why 4 stars. Although it may be too heavy for backpacking, it's too light when compared to a regular axe or a splitting axe. Swing it faster than you would think and it splits wood like butter. I would purchase again...
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT BUY ON AN EXCELLENT TOOL
customer_reviews.text: I live in the deep woods on a dirt road. Often trees block my passage on the road and I have to cut my way out of the situation. The Estwing Camper's Axe gets the job done in short order and is carried in all my vehicles for such contingencies.
customer_reviews.author: Seadog

customer_reviews.title: I want a bigger one
customer_reviews.text: I love this camping axe, I used it almost every weekend all winter mostly splitting wood and throwing at a tree. Not saying that it's the best splitting axe but I have split a lot of wood with it. Also I have thrown it at a tree probably 2000 times, it probably stuck about 700 times and bounced off the tree the rest of the time. Still works! I messed up the bottome of the handle where the impact causes to metal to cut a circle in the bottom but expected. Wish they made a full size axe like this.... 33" would be great
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Solid Axe
customer_reviews.text: Great feel and just the right heft for an axe. Not too big but large enough to get the job done. Very solid feel and should last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Daron L Janis

customer_reviews.title: Great Camp Axe
customer_reviews.text: Keep this in our camper, as most places we camp won't let you bring firewood in, so I'll take this and go scavenging for firewood. It's a medium size axe that works perfectly as a camp axe.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Man

customer_reviews.title: It's a good one.
customer_reviews.text: My dad has one of these and I used it for a day falling timber. Bought one a few days back and I love it. It's the best axe I've bought yet.
customer_reviews.author: Tabbie

customer_reviews.title: I’d buy it again if another jerk steals it!
customer_reviews.text: Great camping axe. Great for campfire size logs. Most importantly, to me, I don’t ever have to be concerned the axe head will fly off.
customer_reviews.author: MarcO

customer_reviews.title: so far has been a great axe
customer_reviews.text: this is a great chopping axe, and should the handle ever fail, which I don't see happening so far, it will be a great chopping hatchet
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: My crew steals them faster than I can replace them!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Typical of any Estwing product. Great tool to have on all of the work trucks. The men can't break the handles out, so they just "lose" them or steal them, instead!
customer_reviews.author: Adam Everett Long

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Axe
customer_reviews.text: I am a huge fan of Estwing products. This is a great little axe...well balanced and can be used one handed. I joke all the time that this is my Rick Grimes zombie killing axe...
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Best little axe ever
customer_reviews.text: Best little axe ever. Love it. I broke a composite axe before I ought this one. I put it through the paces and about 15 cord of wood with no issues and smooth one swing splits.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Best Small Axe!  Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Best axe my husband has ever owned. Good for yard work and camping. You're not going to cost down an oak but a small shrub or medium limbs, it is perfect. Has a nice protective cover when not in use. Quality stainless steel. We've bought our last small axe!
customer_reviews.author: S. Leibert

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy camp Axe
customer_reviews.text: Needed a replacement camp axe. This fits into our camp pack and will certainly get used at the next season. I like the one piece construction and sturdy non slip grip.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth R Crick

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, great value
customer_reviews.text: Love this axe. It's a great weight for swinging, and splits great. I have taught my boys, only 9 & 6 years old, and they can do it. This was also $20 less than I saw in a local store.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron J Stott

customer_reviews.title: Great product not for big wood
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for splitting smaller wood that has already been split or smaller soft wood just doesnt have the weight obviously for bigger stuff. I pretty much knew this when ordering it so overall I'm happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: American made. Fast shipment and a sharp edge
customer_reviews.text: What can I say it’s Estwing!! Own many hammers and sledges .American made .Hands-down the best axe I’ve ever had ! If I bought one of these 30 years ago I wouldn’t have went through 30 wood handle axes.. Thank you Estwing! Came fast and sharp .. I do like a razor edge so had to touch it up but worked great right out the box ...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great design. Crazy sharp
customer_reviews.text: Great design. Crazy sharp, I cut my thump taking off the protective cover the first time. Well balanced and good length for one or two hands (I am 5'8"). I wouldn't recommend it for splitting large firewood but for trimming and for chopping roots it is great.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel B. Beardsley

customer_reviews.title: I’m a fan!
customer_reviews.text: This axis pretty well-made and lightweight. Long as you keep your feet out of the way you can’t go wrong. I mean how do you write a review on an ax? If you wack a log with it you end up with two pieces of wood... 10 out of 10
customer_reviews.author: John Elumbaugh

customer_reviews.title: Finally bought one because of the reduced price. Been looking at it for a while. Nice mid sized axe.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic. Ive been looking at this axe for a while. Its a nice light weight mid sized axe. Great for taking on the wheeler/raft/camping etc. Was always stopped by the price. A little cheaper when I bought this one and it came with the leather embossed cover for the cutting edge that normally sells separately from $10 to $15 about. So bonus. Ad said that but I guess I missed that detail and felt even better about the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Eric in AK

customer_reviews.title: I bought this to keep in my camping trailer. ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep in my camping trailer. The axe was very sharp when it arrived and splits small firewood with ease. The size of this axe is between a hand axe and a full-sized axe. It is well made and includes a sheath for the head. I was not careful the first time I removed the sheath and cut my hand on the blade. Again, it was very sharp when it arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Wiblemo

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking axe
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this smaller axe due to past neck injuries,and it's perfect size and weight,and a nice looking tool in general for an axe,sharp and fine quality
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Light and Good Grip.  A+ on the axe.
customer_reviews.text: I Love this axe. The handle is very comfortable and with the curved end, was easy to hang onto even with sweaty hands. While it is lightweight, I had no problems felling and limbing few trees. It is not intended to be a splitting axe but if camping with, should do the job just fine. I liked that it came with the head cover.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Wimpee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome out of the box
customer_reviews.text: A beast. Haven't used it yet, but looks and feels like you would expect. Have had the hatched for years and love that, so figured it was time to try the "full size." I expect good things.
customer_reviews.author: Rick S.

customer_reviews.title: Best teaching as to us with Scouts
customer_reviews.text: Best ax for a young person to use. They can maintain control and use in any situation. Every Scout Troop needs a couple of them.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not milled correct
customer_reviews.text: The ax was not miled correct it’s not centered and dull. Very unprofessional
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Decent axe for camping
customer_reviews.text: Took this camping for chopping firewood. Works fairly well, unless you're trying to split full size logs. I'd recommend sharpening before use.
customer_reviews.author: Muchas Rojos

customer_reviews.title: I definitely recommend. No issues in performance or quality whatsoever
customer_reviews.text: Arrived falling out of the box but I wont ding the product any stars for that. This thing came sharp and works amazingly. I definitely recommend. No issues in performance or quality whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: ZSW

customer_reviews.title: Perfect axe
customer_reviews.text: Great for camping or when your in the go. Light with but strong. Will get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Estwing campers axe 26"
customer_reviews.text: The axe appears to be well built. I like the long handle. The grip is comfortable and will be nice when you work up a sweat chopping. The reason I gave it 4 stars is the head came chipped in a few spots. If I buy a new axe I like to be the one to put the chips in it. On a positive it is fairly sharp out of the box. The sheath is very durable with the ability to loop it through a belt
customer_reviews.author: Wade

customer_reviews.title: "And my Axe!" (Gimli-LoTRs)
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding product! Love the size of it - not quite full size so very versatile and able to get some swings in a tight area. Not too small for felling very large trees. Chopped away at a monster tree for an hour with my partner who had a full sized axe. My Estwing did more damage than his full size - mainly because of the axe but also because I'm an absloute beast! Very sharp and durrable. Very happy with the purchase! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Estwing quality has changed
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing quality. Estwing used to equate to quality. Ordered two and sent them both back. Finish grinding was of Chinese quality and rubber grip was abraded on both from poor finish work.
customer_reviews.author: Paddles and Props

customer_reviews.title: Axe
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves it!! He had one before and someone took a 5finger discount and we lost it. First one we found like the one we had.
customer_reviews.author: Jeri Burcham

customer_reviews.title: Great axe
customer_reviews.text: I love this axe because it is cast in one piece and I don't have to worry about the head coming off. Used it to chop a stump out of the ground and it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: The Professor

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Best axe ever for chopping wood while camping or at home. Versatile and light in the hands but does a good job cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Matt E.

customer_reviews.title: Great Axe
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for the purposes of camping and keeping in the back of my SUV. In both of these roles the product has performed extraordinarily. It is the perfect size for delivering power while still being easy to wield or store in the car. A great tool for preparing firewood or building an impromptu shelter. It also came in handy when clearing a fallen tree from the road following a severe thunderstorm.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Handle questionable, the rest is rock solid.
customer_reviews.text: It is not as well made as their hammers. The handle made me shop other products to make sure it was proper. Other than that, I think it is rock solid and will be an awesome ax.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a field axe and it works beautifully. Not heavy and just enough reach for those cuts you don’t want to finish with your saw. I even used it to split some decent size knotty logs with no worries, even though I wouldn’t recommend for splitting due to its light weight. Also very little vibration.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Sears

customer_reviews.title: American made!
customer_reviews.text: It has only been used once but stays in my backpack. It’s better than a hatchet.
customer_reviews.author: chad

customer_reviews.title: Hellova tool!!!!
customer_reviews.text: 30 minutes after getting this axe ive already felled a small tree and almost this big one. Love this tool. Well made. Tightly recommended. I also have owned the 14 inch hatchet for five years and it has never let me down. I'll be passing these great tools down to my kids after I'm long gone. They last a lifetime if not more.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Little Axe
customer_reviews.text: Love it perfectly balanced, splits the heck out of wood, great for throwing, this is my 3rd one people keep stealing them they are so good.
customer_reviews.author: James C.

customer_reviews.title: Durable, sharp and just the right size for my RV.
customer_reviews.text: Sharp axe and just the right size for putting in my RV. Smaller hatchets just don't do the job sometimes and this is almost a full size which makes short work of most kindling making chores. I've had several hammers from Estwing and they have all proven very durable - which I fully expect this axe will be too.
customer_reviews.author: Ethosian

customer_reviews.title: Great feel, Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: This ax comes SUPER sharp - my first few whacks at some small overgrown saplings (4") went straight through them and into the dirt. I didn't see that coming! This is one of my favorite new toys, er- tools in my arsenal. I'll have to try actually chopping and splitting wood soon and write another update.
customer_reviews.author: Wes Tongue

customer_reviews.title: Buy fiskars
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, but doesn't work well splitting wood or falling trees. Buy a fiskars. Its a way better product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect all-around tool. I have shorter & longer axes. This one gets the most use. Love it so much, I bought a back-up. Overall, Estwing is a terrific value. Thank you, Estwing.
customer_reviews.author: Primal

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied haven’t used yet but definitely looks and feels as described
customer_reviews.text: I sometimes get stuff on here than I am Excited to get but it doesn’t turn out the way it was described or looks but I can tell you won’t be getting that problem from this it feels great looks great and honestly haven’t tested yet but I’m pretty confident it’s going to hold up definitely a must get item
customer_reviews.author: Tanner R

customer_reviews.title: Great all around camp axe
customer_reviews.text: My dad had one of these axes, and I always wanted one. When I finally got it, it wasn't exactly what I remembered. I feel that the rubber is not molded as well as the originals. With all that said, this is a great tough tool. It is not the best chopper, but I got is razor sharp and it hold the edge well.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon D Goldthwaite

product_meta.title: Estwing Camper's Axe - 26" Wood Splitting Tool with All Steel Construction & Shock Reduction Grip - E45A
product_meta.description:
Color:BlueEstwing's world famous Camper's axe is the choice of outdoorsmen everywhere. The forged steel head is hand polished to a beautiful finish. This classic axe offers unsurpassed balance and temper. It's patented Shock Reduction Grip reduces impact virbation by 70%. The Camper's axe includes a rugged ballistic nylon sheath with belt loop so it can always have your tool close at hand. It has a tempered 4 in. cutting edge for easy cutting. A must for all campers and outdoorsman alike! Estwing Axes are proudly forged in the in USA using the finest American steel. Please always wear eye protection while using this tool.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
For felling, trimming trees and or splitting wood, notching timbers, driving wooden or plastic stakes. Forged one-piece solid steel construction to eliminate loose heads Nylon vinyl deep cushion grips bonded to steel handle for comfort and durability. Since 1923, the Estwing family and its employees have taken pride in designing and manufacturing the world's most durable, comfortable and attractive striking and struck tools. All claw hammers, axes, specialty tools and pry bars are manufactured to the highest possible standards and offer a true value to both tradesmen and craftsmen alike.
feature_bullets: Crafted from the highest quality materials

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,054 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
